question:
Dr. B.R. Ambedkar was associated with which of the following?
  1. Mahad Satyagraha
  2. Bahishkrit Bharat
  3. Samaj Samata Sangh
Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation: Bahishkrit Bharat newspaper was published by B.R. Ambedkar. It announced that those members of the depressed classes who wanted to wash out the stigma of polluters of Mahad water tank (called Chowdar tank) and who wanted to denounce assaults on their representatives should enlist themselves at office of Bahishkrit Hitakarni Sabha in Bombay. Mahad Satyagraha was a Satyagraha led by B. R. Ambedkar on 20 March 1927 to allow untouchables to use water in a public tank in Mahad. Samaj Samata Sangh established in September 1927 by Hon. Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar for the propagation of social equality.
